This investment is part of Quest Global's pre-IPO fundraising. Singapore's Temasek may also secure a smaller stake. Quest Global is also considering a reverse flip to list on Indian stock exchanges.

items.title: Landmark trial accusing social media companies of addicting children to their platforms begins
items.summary: Landmark trial accusing social media companies of addicting children to their platforms begins

items.title: Warsh Will Face Challenges Shrinking Fed’s Portfolio, Citi Says
items.summary: Federal Reserve Chair nominee Kevin Warsh is likely to take a gradual approach to shrinking the central bank’s $6.6 trillion portfolio to avoid rekindling money market tensions, according to strategists at Citigroup Inc.

items.title: India’s fast-growing economy to support banking sector stability: Moody’s
items.summary: India's banking sector outlook is stable. Moody's Ratings projects low non-performing assets. Robust economic growth will support the sector's fundamentals. Profitability is expected to remain stable. Loan growth will align with deposits. Banks are well-capitalised. Strong economic growth will support asset quality.

items.title: Ajanta may raise Rs 2,000 crore to buy Restaurant Brands Asia
items.summary: The promoter group is looking to raise about ₹2,000 crore through a combination of promoter-level borrowing and debt at the operating company, according to people familiar with the discussions.

items.title: Budget for 2026-27 highlights Govt’s push for reforms, policy predictability: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman met with US-India Strategic Partnership Forum board members. She emphasized the Budget's reforms for semiconductors, electronics, and bio-pharma. The government aims to boost manufacturing and support small and medium enterprises. These initiatives are designed to encourage long-term investment and strengthen India's economic capacity. The focus is on strategic sectors and policy predictability.

items.title: Areion Group wins Rs 936-crore bid for Aviom India Housing Finance despite higher Unity SFB offer
items.summary: Areion Group secured the winning bid for Aviom India Housing Finance. Secured lenders unanimously backed Areion's Rs 936-crore offer. This plan offers lenders a recovery of about 65%. Unity Small Finance Bank had placed a higher bid but with conditions. Lenders preferred Areion's unconditional offer for certainty of recovery.

items.title: New I-T rules, forms by March; Income Tax Act to take effect from April 1, 2026
items.summary: While income tax returns under the new Act will be filed by taxpayers in July 2027, under the new rules the forms, including advance tax and tax deduction at source, will come into force by April 1, 2026. The new rules, which overhaul employee perquisite valuation, will be applicable to salaried taxpayers under both the old and the new tax regimes.

items.title: Digital frauds drop as banks step up vigil
items.summary: Amid a wave of rising AI-generated frauds, banks and regulators are responding with strengthened security controls, multi-factor authentication, real-time fraud-monitoring systems and customer awareness campaigns. As a customer protection measure, the RBI in its February Monetary Policy announced compensation of up to Rs 25,000 for small-value payment frauds if the customers are genuinely cheated.

items.title: NHB pushes for lower home loan rates, lenders delay cuts till April
items.summary: The National Housing Bank is pushing housing finance companies to lower lending rates for customers.  However, these companies plan to wait until April for their internal benchmarks to be reset before making significant rate cuts.  Some lenders have already made minor reductions.  This move aims to pass on reduced borrowing costs to existing borrowers.

items.title: Big opportunities open up with FTAs: Tata Sons Chief N Chandrasekaran
items.summary: Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran expressed optimism about India's trade deals with the EU, UK, and US, foreseeing significant opportunities. He spoke at the inauguration of Tata Motors and Jaguar Land Rover's integrated manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu, which will produce 300,000 vehicles annually, including electric models and high-end vehicles like the Range Rover Evoque.

items.title: Europe steel prices to remain higher for longer: Tata Steel
items.summary: European steel prices are expected to increase significantly in the coming years. New carbon emission regulations and tariffs are driving this structural shift. Tata Steel sees improved profitability in its Netherlands operations due to these changes. The company anticipates positive developments for the UK steel industry soon. Tata Steel's Indian operations continue to grow robustly.

items.title: Decide on Piramal's Dahej plant in a week: Supreme Court to Gujarat Pollution Control Board
items.summary: The Supreme Court has issued a swift order for the Gujarat Pollution Control Board to review Piramal Pharma's appeal to reactivate its Dahej manufacturing site, which was closed due to serious allegations related to hazardous waste management. The firm sought interim relief but was turned down by the court.

items.title: ET Graphics: 60% of India’s trade to shift to preferential terms after EU, US, GCC deals
items.summary: India is set to conduct over 60% of its trade on preferential terms following recent agreements with the EU, US, and GCC. This strategic move aims to integrate India into global value chains, with exports to these partners showing a significant 8.5% growth, outpacing overall export expansion.

items.title: Impresario in talks to acquire mid-sized restaurant chains ahead of proposed IPO
items.summary: Impresario Entertainment & Hospitality, owner of Social and Smoke House Deli, is in talks to acquire several mid-sized restaurant chains to scale up ahead of a proposed public listing. The company, majority-owned by India Resurgence Fund, aims to consolidate its position in the competitive food and beverage industry.

items.title: Exports may hit $1 Tn in FY27 on new trade deals, tariff cuts
items.summary: India's exports are poised for a record $1,000 billion in 2026-27. New trade agreements with the US and EU are expected to boost orders. Reduced US tariffs on Indian goods offer a competitive edge. Exporters anticipate significant growth in sectors like chemicals, footwear, and marine products. This development signals a promising future for India's international trade.

items.title: Air Canada Halts Service to Cuba After US Pressure Cuts Off Fuel
items.summary: Cuba is at risk of losing vital airline service as it prepares to run out of aviation fuel, with at least one major carrier, Air Canada, suspending all service to the island as a result.

items.title: States told to finalise pacts to meet green energy purchase obligations
items.summary: The Indian government is urging states to finalize power sale agreements for renewable energy projects. This initiative aims to help states meet their renewable purchase obligations. Around 43.9 GW of capacity awaits these agreements for quick implementation. Discussions are ongoing with about 15 states falling short of their targets. This move is crucial for India's ambitious 2030 renewable energy goals.

items.title: Import tariffs on agriculture items to be phased out over 10 years
items.summary: India is set to embark on a gradual decrease in import duties on a variety of agricultural and intermediate goods from the US. This strategic, decade-long plan is designed to give local industries a chance to adapt while ensuring that critical sectors such as meat, poultry, and dairy are shielded.

items.title: US may refund small penalties on India over Russian oil buys
items.summary: There’s good news for India as it might see a reduction in penalties for importing Russian crude oil, with refunds applicable for duties collected before a recent US executive order rescinded those fees. Furthermore, the anticipated trade agreement with the US promises to cut tariffs on Indian exports, setting the stage for a comprehensive trade collaboration that spans various sectors.

items.title: India’s hotel industry stays resilient in 2025 despite geopolitics, airline crisis and weather woes
items.summary: India's hospitality sector demonstrated remarkable resilience in 2025, overcoming geopolitical challenges and adverse conditions to achieve sustained growth. Hotels saw significant increases in occupancy, average daily rates, and revenue per available room, driven by a substantial addition of new rooms and strong domestic travel demand.

items.title: India floats draft Digital Trade Facilitation Bill for e-trade documents’ legal recognition
items.summary: The Indian government is seeking public feedback on the proposed Digital Trade Facilitation Bill, 2026. This legislation aims to give legal standing to electronic trade documents. It will also govern the use and cross-border acceptance of digital identities and trust services. The bill seeks to streamline international trade by ensuring digital documents are recognized globally.

items.title: Centre kicks off search for Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's new  director general
items.summary: The government is actively seeking a new chief for the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) as the current director general retires in June. Alongside this, 23 new officials are being hired to strengthen the agency. This move comes amid intense scrutiny of AAIB's performance following last year's fatal Air India crash, with concerns raised about communication and transparency.

items.title: Unfunded OPS likely to exert severe pressure on their finances: MoS Finance
items.summary: States reverting to the Old Pension Scheme face significant financial strain. This unfunded scheme threatens to increase long-term liabilities and limit capital spending. Banks, however, are reporting record profits and improved asset quality. India's external debt remains manageable, and agricultural lending is growing.

items.title: FMCG companies talk premium but sell value as affordability drives volumes
items.summary: The divergence points to a consumer environment where affordability, not uptrading, is driving demand

items.title: NCLT clears Hotel Horizon resolution; NCLAT bars equity creation for now
items.summary: The National Company Law Tribunal has approved the acquisition of Hotel Horizon by a consortium including Oberoi Realty. This follows the company's admission of liabilities. The successful bidder's plan offers a significant recovery for lenders. However, the NCLT order has been challenged at the NCLAT, which has put a stay on further actions pending its final ruling.

items.title: New income tax rules raise PAN threshold, meal allowances
items.summary: The draft Income-tax Rules, 2026, streamline processes, increasing PAN limits and meal allowances. Pre-filled forms will aid taxpayers, while adjustments in employer allowances reflect market realities, promoting ease of filing and benefiting employees.

items.title: BSE Q3 results: Profit jumps nearly threefold to ₹602 cr; revenue up 62%
items.summary:
Leading stock exchange BSE on Monday reported a nearly three times jump in consolidated profit to Rs 602 crore for the December quarter, driven by strong growth in equity derivatives trading, listings and mutual fund transactions.
The exchange posted a profit of Rs 220 crore in the corresponding period of the last fiscal year.
Total revenue for the quarter under review stood at an all-time high of Rs 1,334 crore, up 61 per cent from Rs 829 crore a year earlier, BSE said in a statement.
This also marks the exchange's 11th consecutive record performance.
Further, operating expenses declined 4 pe

items.title: Aviation regulator DGCA issued 352 show cause notices to airlines for violations in last 2 years
items.summary: Aviation watchdog DGCA issued 352 show cause notices to airlines over two years. IndiGo and Air India received the most notices. Penalties were imposed on 139 notices, with warnings issued for 113. The DGCA monitors aircraft induction and on-time performance.

items.title: The Ramco Cements Q3 net profit jumps 2-fold to ₹385.63 cr, revenue up 6%
items.summary:
The Ramco Cements Ltd on Monday reported an over two-fold jump year-on-year in its consolidated net profit at Rs 385.63 crore in the December quarter of FY26, helped by improvement in cement prices and operational efficiencies.
The company posted a net profit of Rs 181.58 crore during the October-December quarter of the previous fiscal, according to a regulatory filing by The Ramco Cements.
Revenue from operations was up 6.16 per cent to Rs 2,105.68 crore in the December quarter of FY26. It was at Rs 1,983.45 crore in the corresponding period of the previous fiscal.
"During Q3 FY26, the cement

items.title: Airlines' cumulative loss touched Rs 5,289.73 crore in 2024-25: Govt
items.summary: Indian airlines faced significant financial challenges last fiscal year. The sector collectively lost over Rs 5,289 crore. Air India Group alone reported a substantial loss of Rs 9,808 crore. Only four airlines, including IndiGo, managed to achieve profitability. Airfares are determined by market forces, not government regulation. This data was presented to the Rajya Sabha.

Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri emphasized protecting consumers and ensuring adequate, affordable, and secure energy supplies. India aims for stable energy prices and secure supplies globally. The country imports energy from multiple sources to achieve availability, fair pricing, and reliability. India plays a role in stabilizing global energy markets.

items.title: Bata India Q3 net profit up 12.6% at ₹66.1 cr, revenue rises 2.8%
items.summary:
Leading shoemaker Bata India Ltd on Monday reported a 12.61 per cent rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 66.1 crore in the December quarter of FY'26 compared to the year-ago period.
It had posted a net profit of Rs 58.7 crore in the previous October-December a year ago, according to a regulatory filing from Bata India.
Bata's revenue from operations was up 2.81 per cent to Rs 944.68 crore during the quarter under review compared to Rs 918.79 crore in the corresponding quarter a year ago.

This strategic step aligns with growing global demand for copper.

Total revenue from operations increased to Rs 8,646 crore during the quarter as compared with Rs 7,979 crore in the year-ago period, the drug firm said in a statement.

items.title: "Quota" to US on apples less than current imports: Piyush Goyal

And a large quantity of that comes from the United States of America. We have not opened up apples. We have given them a quota on apples, which we will procure from there. That is less than the Current imports of apples from the USA," Goyal said in an interview with ANI.

items.title: US President Biden's TikTok, oil moves test the loyalty of young voters
items.summary:
Recent moves by President Joe Biden to pressure TikTok over its Chinese ownership and approve oil drilling in an untapped area of Alaska are testing the loyalty of young voters, a group that's largely been in his corner.
Youth turnout surged in the three elections since Donald Trump was elected president in 2016, helping Biden eke out victories in swing states in 2020, pick up a Democratic Senate seat in the 2022 election and stem potential losses in the House.
But the 80-year-old president has never been the favorite candidate of young liberals itching for a new generation of American leaders

items.title: Afghanistan beats Pakistan for first time in Twenty20 international cricket
items.summary:
Afghanistan defeated Pakistan in a Twenty20 for the first time on Friday after the latter was restricted to 92-9.
Pakistan, without five rested frontline players including captain Babar Azam, struggled on a slow and low pitch at Sharjah Cricket Stadium against the Afghans, whose six bowlers shared all nine wickets.
Afghanistan overcame falling to 45-4 in the 10th over to cruise home at 98-4 and win by six wickets with more than two overs to spare.
Mohammad Nabi raised Afghanistan's first victory over Pakistan in five attempts over the past decade with a straight six over long off.

items.title: 2 dead, 9 missing in chocolate factory blast in Pennsylvania: Police
items.summary:
An explosion at a chocolate factory in Pennsylvania Friday evening killed two people and left several others missing as investigators begin to determine a cause.
West Reading Borough Police Department Chief of Police Wayne Holben confirmed there were two fatalities, nine people missing and several others injured by the explosion at the R.M. Palmer Co. plant in West Reading.
The explosion at 4:57 p.m. sent a plume of black smoke into the air and resulted in the destruction of a building at the facility and damage to a neighbouring building. The cause of the explosion remains under investigation

items.title: Pak receives $2 bn rollover deposits from China to get IMF bailout: Report
items.summary:
Cash-strapped Pakistan has received a rollover of USD 2 billion in deposits for a period of one year from its all-weather ally China to help Islamabad get a much-required bailout from the IMF to stabilise its economy, a media report said on Friday.
The rollover, which basically is not a loan but a financial deposit to be kept at Pakistan's central bank for a period of one year, is one of the requirements of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in meeting its external financing needs in order to move towards inking the staff-level agreement, The News International reported.

items.title: WHO calls for intensified whole-of-government approach to end tuberculosis
items.summary:
On World TB Day, WHO Friday called for an intensified whole-of-government and whole-of-society approach to end the disease globally.
It also highlighted the urgent need for strengthening high-level leadership and investments and accelerating the uptake of innovations and new recommendations of the world health body.
Globally, the COVID-19 pandemic has not just stalled but reversed years of progress towards ending tuberculosis, said WHO Regional Director for South-East Asia Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh.

items.title: Hong Kong traffic accident leaves some 70 people injured including children
items.summary:
Four passenger buses and a truck collided near a Hong Kong road tunnel on Friday and about 70 people were injured, including children. Most of the injuries were minor.
The accident occurred after midday near a tunnel entrance on Tseung Kwan O Road in Lam Tin, a residential area in Kowloon.
Some 60 people sustained light injuries and around nine others suffered more serious injuries, police said.
It was unclear what caused the collision.

items.title: Nuclear drone to generate 'radioactive tsumani' tested: North Korea
items.summary:
North Korea claimed on Friday to have tested a nuclear-capable underwater drone designed to generate a gigantic radioactive tsunami that would destroy naval strike groups and ports. Analysts were skeptical that the device presents a major new threat, but the test underlines the North's commitment to raising nuclear threats.
The test this week came as the United States reportedly planned to deploy aircraft carrier strike groups and other advanced assets to waters off the Korean Peninsula.

items.title: Suspected Iranian drone strike kills US contractor in Syria: Pentagon
items.summary:
A US contractor was killed and five US service members and one other US contractor were wounded when a suspected Iranian drone struck a facility on a coalition base in northeast Syria on Thursday, the Pentagon said.
In a statement released late Thursday, Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said US Central Command forces retaliated with precision airstrikes against facilities in eastern Syria used by groups affiliated with Iran's Revolutionary Guard.
The Defence Department said the intelligence community had determined the unmanned aerial vehicle was of Iranian origin.

North Korea said Friday its latest cruise missile launches this week were part of nuclear attack simulations that also involved a test of a purported underwater attack drone as leader Kim Jong Un vowed to make his rivals plunge into despair.
North Korea has stepped up its weapons demonstrations this month in a tit-for-tat response to the United States' expanding military exercises with ally South Korea aimed at countering the North's growing nuclear threat.
